info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CABARRUS...SOUTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG AND NORTH CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES... At 422 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles east of Uptown Charlotte, or near Mint Hill, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Harrisburg, Reedy Creek Park, The Plaza, Midland, Fairview In Union County, Stallings and South Charlotte. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred. A new Severe Thunderstorm was developing on the Mecklenburg/Cabarrus County line and also moving east at 10 mph. This storm will likely produce storm damage in the southern part of Cabarrus near Midland.
